content: I can't believe that God put us on this earth to be ordinary.

content: I have an everyday religion that works for me. Love yourself first, and everything else falls into line.

content: Nature gave us one tongue and two ears so we could hear twice as much as we speak.

content: When I was 40, my doctor advised me that a man in his 40s shouldn't play tennis. I heeded his advice carefully and could hardly wait until I reached 50 to start again.

content: The future is completely open, and we are writing it moment to moment.

content: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.

content: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.

content: Never mistake activity for achievement.

content: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.

content: The simplest things are often the truest.
author: Richard Bach

content: Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.

content: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.

content: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.

content: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.

content: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.

content: Whatever happens, take responsibility.

content: Through perseverance many people win success out of what seemed destined to be certain failure.

content: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves.

content: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.

author: Swami Vivekananda

content: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
author: John F. Kennedy
